HTML consists of elements, each of which may be modified by some number of attributes. HTML documents are connected to each other with links.

trans-unit.source: HTML elements

trans-unit.source: HTML elements are usually "inline" or "block-level" elements. An inline element occupies only the space bounded by the tags that define it. A block-level element occupies the entire space of its parent element (container), thereby creating a "block."
trans-unit.target: Los elementos de HTML suelen ser elementos "en l√≠nea" o "a nivel de bloque".Un elemento inline ocupa s√≥lo el espacio delimitado por las etiquetas que lo definen.Un elemento a nivel de bloque ocupa todo el espacio de su elemento padre (contenedor),creando as√≠ un "bloque".

trans-unit.source: HTML is comprised of several kinds of content, each of which is allowed to be used in certain contexts and is disallowed in others. Similarly, each has a set of other content categories they can contain and elements that can or can't be used in them. This is a guide to these categories.

HTML is comprised of several kinds of content, each of which is allowed to be used in certain contexts and is disallowed in others. Similarly, each has a set of other content categories they can contain and elements which can or can't be used in them. This is a guide to these categories.

trans-unit.target: Soporte de medios HTML en Firefox

trans-unit.source: HTML note with additional information about the contact. Plural. Each element is some kind of object.
trans-unit.target: Nota HTML con información adicional sobre el contacto. Plural. Cada elemento es una especie de objeto.

trans-unit.source: HTML offers a selection of elements which help to create interactive user interface objects.
trans-unit.target: El HTML ofrece una selecci√≥n de elementos que ayudan a crear objetos interactivos de la interfaz de usuario.

trans-unit.source: HTML provides a crossorigin attribute for images that, in combination with an appropriate CORS header, allows images defined by the <img> element that are loaded from foreign origins to be used in a <canvas> as if they had been loaded from the current origin.
trans-unit.target: HTML proporciona un atributo de origen crossorigin para imágenes que, en combinación con un encabezado CORS apropiado , permite que las imágenes definidas por el elemento <img> que se cargan desde orígenes externos se usen en un <canvas> como si se hubieran cargado desde el origen actual. .

trans-unit.source: HTML provides a number of elements which can be used together to create forms which the user can fill out and submit to the Web site or application. There's a great deal of further information about this available in the HTML forms guide.
trans-unit.target: HTML proporciona una serie de elementos que pueden utilizarse juntos para crear formularios que el usuario puede completar y enviar al sitio web o la aplicación. Hay mucha más información sobre esto disponible en la guía de formularios HTML .

trans-unit.target: El HTML soporta varios recursos multimedia como im√°genes,audio y video.

trans-unit.source: HTML uses "markup" to annotate text, images, and other content for display in a Web browser. HTML markup includes special "elements" such as <head>, <title>, <body>, <header>, <footer>, <article>, <section>, <p>, <div>, <span>, <img>, <aside>, <audio>, <canvas>, <datalist>, <details>, <embed>, <nav>, <output>, <progress>, <video> and many others.
trans-unit.target: HTML utiliza "marcado" para anotar texto, imágenes y otro contenido para mostrar en un navegador web. El marcado HTML incluye "elementos" especiales como <head> , <title> , <body> , <header> , <footer> , <article> , <section> , <p> , <div> , <span> , <img> , <aside> , <audio> , <canvas> , <datalist> , <details> , <embed> , <nav> , <output> , <progress> , <video> y muchos otros.

trans-unit.source: HTML uses "markup" to annotate text, images, and other content for display in a Web browser. trans-unit.source: HTML5 defines restrictions on the allowed values of boolean attributes: If the attribute is present, its value must either be the empty string (equivalently, the attribute may have an unassigned value), or a value that is an ASCII case-insensitive match for the attribute’s canonical name, with no leading or trailing whitespace. The following examples are valid ways to mark up a boolean attribute:

HTML5 supports several media elements. The <video> and <audio> elements may be used singly or combined with the <source> element. A short example illustrates. Although the <video> and <audio> elements both contain src attributes, this sample uses the <source> element to offer video files in multiple formats, allowing each browser to select an element that it supports.
trans-unit.target: HTML5 admite varios elementos multimedia. Los elementos <video> y <audio> pueden usarse individualmente o combinados con el elemento <source> . Un breve ejemplo lo ilustra. Aunque los elementos <video> y <audio> contienen atributos src, esta muestra utiliza el elemento <source> para ofrecer archivos de video en múltiples formatos, permitiendo que cada navegador seleccione un elemento que admita.

trans-unit.source: HTML5-compliant browsers automatically create a <head> element if its tags are omitted in the markup. This auto-creation is not guaranteed in ancient browsers.

Here however, we will use a rel value of preload, which turns the <link> element into a preloader for pretty much any resource we want. At a basic level, you also need to specify the path to the resource to be preloaded in the href attribute, and the type of resource you are preloading in the as attribute.
trans-unit.target: Sin embargo, aquí usaremos un valor rel de preload , que convierte el elemento <link> en un precargador para prácticamente cualquier recurso que queramos. En un nivel básico, también debe especificar la ruta al recurso que se precargará en el atributo href y el tipo de recurso que está precargando en el atributo as .

As a final touch, the list attribute contains the ID of a <datalist> whose <option>s specify a set of suggested values the user can choose from.

We put it on a separate <span> element for added flexibility; some browsers don't display generated content very effectively on some types of form inputs (read for example the section on <input type="date"> validation).

Lo colocamos en un elemento <span> separado para mayor flexibilidad; algunos navegadores no muestran el contenido generado de forma muy eficaz en algunos tipos de entradas de formulario (lea, por ejemplo, la sección sobre validación de <input type="date"> ).

trans-unit.source: Hexadecimal string notation
trans-unit.target: Notaci√≥n de cuerda hexadecimal

trans-unit.source: Hexadecimal string notation represents a color using hexadecimal digits to represent each of the color components (red, green, and blue). It may also include a fourth component: the alpha channel (or opacity). Each color component can be represented as a number between 0 and 255 (0x00 and 0xFF) or, optionally, as a number between 0 and 15 (0x0 and 0xF). All components must be specified using the same number of digits. If you use the single-digit notation, the final color is computed by using each component's digit twice; that is, "#D" becomes "#DD" when drawing.
trans-unit.target: La notación de cadena hexadecimal representa un color utilizando dígitos hexadecimales para representar cada uno de los componentes del color (rojo, verde y azul). También puede incluir un cuarto componente: el canal alfa (u opacidad). Cada componente de color se puede representar como un número entre 0 y 255 (0x00 y 0xFF) u, opcionalmente, como un número entre 0 y 15 (0x0 y 0xF). Todos los componentes deben especificarse con el mismo número de dígitos. Si usa la notación de un solo dígito, el color final se calcula usando el dígito de cada componente dos veces; es decir, "#D" se convierte en "#DD" al dibujar.

trans-unit.source: Hidden elements shouldn't be linked from non-hidden elements, and elements that are descendants of a hidden element are still active, which means that script elements can still execute and form elements can still submit. Elements and scripts may, however, refer to elements that are hidden in other contexts.
trans-unit.target: Los elementos ocultos no deben vincularse a los elementos no ocultos,y los elementos que son descendientes de un elemento oculto siguen activos,lo que significa que los elementos de escritura todav√≠a pueden ejecutarse y los elementos de forma todav√≠a pueden presentarse.Sin embargo,los elementos y guiones pueden referirse a elementos que est√°n ocultos en otros contextos.

trans-unit.source: Hidden inputs are also used to store and submit security tokens or secrets, for the purposes of improving website security. The basic idea is that if a user is filling in a sensitive form, such as a form on their banking website to transfer some money to another account, the secret they would be provided with would prove that they are who they say they are, and that they are using the correct form to submit the transfer request.
trans-unit.target: Las entradas ocultas también se utilizan para almacenar y enviar tokens de seguridad o secretos , con el fin de mejorar la seguridad del sitio web. La idea básica es que si un usuario está completando un formulario sensible, como un formulario en su sitio web bancario para transferir dinero a otra cuenta, el secreto que se le proporcionaría demostraría que es quien dice ser, y que están usando el formulario correcto para enviar la solicitud de transferencia.

trans-unit.source: Hidden inputs don't participate in constraint validation; they have no real value to be constrained.
trans-unit.target: Los insumos ocultos no participan en la validaci√≥n de la restricci√≥n;no tienen un valor real para ser restringidos.

trans-unit.source: Historically, Firefox has allowed keyboard and mouse events to bubble up from the <option> element to the parent <select> element, although this behavior is inconsistent across many browsers. For better Web compatibility (and for technical reasons), they will not bubble up when Firefox is in multi-process mode and the <select> element is displayed as a drop-down list. The behavior is unchanged if the <select> is presented inline and it has either the multiple attribute defined or a size attribute set to more than 1. Rather than watching <option> elements for events, you should watch for change events on <select>. See bug 1090602 for details.

Historically, Firefox has allowed keyboard and mouse events to bubble up from the <option> element to the parent <select> element, although this behavior is inconsistent across many browsers. For better Web compatibility (and for technical reasons), when Firefox is in multi-process mode and the <select> element is displayed as a drop-down list. The behavior is unchanged if the <select> is presented inline and it has either the multiple attribute defined or a size attribute set to more than 1. Rather than watching <option> elements for events, you should watch for change events on <select>. See bug 1090602 for details.
trans-unit.target: Históricamente, Firefox ha permitido que los eventos de teclado y mouse fluyan desde el elemento <option> hasta el elemento <select> principal , aunque este comportamiento es inconsistente en muchos navegadores. Para una mejor compatibilidad con la Web (y por razones técnicas), cuando Firefox está en modo multiproceso y el elemento <select> se muestra como una lista desplegable. El comportamiento no cambia si <select> se presenta en línea y tiene el atributo multiple definido o un atributo de size establecido en más de 1 . En lugar de mirar los elementos de <option> para los eventos, debe estar atento a los eventos de cambio en <select> . Consulte el error 1090602 para obtener más detalles.

trans-unit.source: Historically, Firefox has allowed keyboard and mouse events to bubble up from the <option> element to the parent <select> element, although this behavior is inconsistent across many browsers. For better Web compatibility (and for technical reasons), when Firefox is in multi-process mode the <select> element is displayed as a drop-down list. The behavior is unchanged if the <select> is presented inline and it has either the multiple attribute defined or a size attribute set to more than 1. Rather than watching <option> elements for events, you should watch for change events on <select>. See bug 1090602 for details.
trans-unit.target: Históricamente, Firefox ha permitido que los eventos de teclado y mouse fluyan desde el elemento <option> hasta el elemento <select> principal , aunque este comportamiento es inconsistente en muchos navegadores. Para una mejor compatibilidad con la Web (y por razones técnicas), cuando Firefox está en modo multiproceso, el elemento <select> se muestra como una lista desplegable. El comportamiento no cambia si <select> se presenta en línea y tiene el atributo múltiple definido o un atributo de tamaño establecido en más de 1. En lugar de ver los elementos de <option> en busca de eventos, debe observar los eventos de cambio en <select> . Consulte el error 1090602 para obtener más detalles.

trans-unit.source: Historically, the <embed> element could be used with audio player plug-ins to play audio in the background in most browsers. However, even this is no longer appropriate, and you should use <audio> instead, since it's more capable, more compatible, and doesn't require plug-ins.
trans-unit.target: Históricamente, el elemento <embed> podría usarse con complementos de reproductor de audio para reproducir audio en segundo plano en la mayoría de los navegadores. Sin embargo, incluso esto ya no es apropiado, y debería usar <audio> en su lugar, ya que es más capaz, más compatible y no requiere complementos.

trans-unit.source: IDL attributes are not always strings; for example, input.maxlength is a number (a signed long). When using IDL attributes, you read or set values of the desired type, so input.maxlength is always going to return a number and when you set input.maxlength ,it wants a number. If you pass another type, it is automatically converted to a number as specified by the standard JavaScript rules for type conversion.
trans-unit.target: Los atributos IDL no siempre son cadenas; por ejemplo, input.maxlength es un número (un signo largo). Cuando usa atributos IDL, lee o establece valores del tipo deseado, por lo que input.maxlength siempre devolverá un número y cuando establece input.maxlength , quiere un número. Si pasa otro tipo, se convierte automáticamente en un número según lo especificado por las reglas estándar de JavaScript para la conversión de tipos.

trans-unit.source: IDL attributes are not always strings; for example, input.maxlength is a number (a signed long). When using IDL attributes, you read or set values of the desired type, so input.maxlength is always going to return a number and when you set input.maxlength, it wants a number. If you pass another type, it is automatically converted to a number as specified by the standard JavaScript rules for type conversion.

IDL attributes can reflect other types such as unsigned long, URLs, booleans, etc. Unfortunately, there are no clear rules and the way IDL attributes behave in conjunction with their corresponding content attributes depends on the attribute. Most of the time, it will follow the rules laid out in the specification, but sometimes it doesn't. HTML specifications try to make this as developer-friendly as possible, but for various reasons (mostly historical), some attributes behave oddly (select.size, for example) and you should read the specifications to understand how exactly they behave.
trans-unit.target: Los atributos IDL pueden reflejar otros tipos , como unsigned long, URL, booleanos, etc. Desafortunadamente, no hay reglas claras y la forma en que los atributos IDL se comportan junto con sus atributos de contenido correspondientes depende del atributo. La mayoría de las veces, seguirá las reglas establecidas en la especificación , pero a veces no es así. Las especificaciones HTML intentan hacer que esto sea lo más amigable posible para los desarrolladores, pero por varias razones (principalmente históricas), algunos atributos se comportan de manera extraña ( select.size , por ejemplo) y debe leer las especificaciones para comprender cómo se comportan exactamente.

trans-unit.source: Ideally, consider alternate ways to present the table's content, including breaking it apart into a collection of smaller, related tables that don't have to rely on using the colspan and rowspan attributes. In addition to helping people who use assistive technology understand the table's content, this may also benefit people with cognitive concerns who may have difficulty understanding the associations the table layout is describing.

Además de ayudar a las personas que utilizan tecnología de asistencia a comprender el contenido de la mesa, esto también puede beneficiar a las personas con problemas cognitivos que pueden tener dificultades para comprender las asociaciones que describe el diseño de la mesa.

trans-unit.source: If any is not explicity set, valid values for the number, date/time input types, and range input types are equal to the basis for stepping — the min value and increments of the step value, up to the max value, if specified.

If any is not explicity set, valid values for the number, date/time input types, and range input types are equal to the basis for stepping - the min value and increments of the step value, up to the max value, if specified. For example, if we have <input type="number" min="10" step="2"> any even integer, 10 or great, is valid. If omitted, <input type="number">, any integer is valid, but floats, like 4.2, are not valid, as step defaults to 1. For 4.2 to be valid, step would have had to be set to any, 0.1, 0.2, or any the min value would have had to be a number ending in .2, such as <input type="number" min="-5.2">

If the autocomplete attribute is not specified on a <textarea> element, then the browser uses the autocomplete attribute value of the <textarea> element's form owner. The form owner is either the <form> element that this <textarea> element is a descendant of or the form element whose id is specified by the form attribute of the input element. For more information, see the autocomplete attribute in <form>.
trans-unit.target: Si el atributo de autocomplete no se especifica en un elemento <textarea> , el navegador usa el valor del atributo de autocomplete del propietario del formulario del elemento <textarea> . Para obtener más información, consulte el atributo de autocomplete en <form> .

trans-unit.source: If the crossorigin attribute is specified, then a CORS request is sent (with the Origin request header); but if the server does not opt into allowing cross-origin access to the image data by the origin site (by not sending any Access-Control-Allow-Origin response header, or by not including the site's origin in any Access-Control-Allow-Origin response header it does send), then the browser marks the image as tainted and restricts access to its image data, preventing its usage in <canvas> elements.

If the crossorigin attribute is not specified, then a non-CORS request is sent (without the Origin request header), and the browser marks the image as tainted and restricts access to its image data, preventing its usage in <canvas> elements.

If the disabled attribute isn't specified, the button inherits its disabled state from its parent element. This makes it possible to enable and disable groups of elements all at once by enclosing them in a container such as a <fieldset> element, and then setting disabled on the container.
trans-unit.target: Si no se especifica el atributo disabled , el botón hereda su estado disabled de su elemento principal. Esto hace posible habilitar y deshabilitar grupos de elementos a la vez encerrándolos en un contenedor como un elemento <fieldset> , y luego estableciendo disabled en el contenedor.

trans-unit.source: If the indeterminate attribute is present on the <input> element defining a checkbox, the checkbox's value is neither true nor false, but is instead indeterminate, meaning that it's state cannot be determined or stated in pure binary terms. This may happen, for instance, if the state of the checkbox depends on multiple other checkboxes, and those checkboxes have different values.

If the pattern attribute is present but is not specified or is invalid, no regular expression is applied and this attribute is ignored completely. If the pattern attribute is valid and a non-empty value does not match the pattern, constraint validation will prevent form submission.

If the type attribute isn't specified, the media's type is retrieved from the server and checked to see if the user agent can handle it; if it can't be rendered, the next <source> is checked. If the type attribute is specified, it's compared against the types the user agent can present, and if it's not recognized, the server doesn't even get queried; instead, the next <source> element is checked at once.
trans-unit.target: Si no se especifica el atributo de type , el tipo del medio se recupera del servidor y se verifica para ver si el agente de usuario puede manejarlo; si no se puede renderizar, se marca el siguiente <source> . Si se especifica el atributo de type , se compara con los tipos que el agente de usuario puede presentar, y si no se reconoce, el servidor ni siquiera recibe consultas; en su lugar, el siguiente elemento <source> se comprueba a la vez.

trans-unit.source: If the audio is being streamed, it's possible that the user agent may not be able to obtain some parts of the resource if that data has expired from the media buffer. Other audio may have a media timeline that doesn't start at 0 seconds, so setting currentTime to a time before that would fail. For example, if the audio's media timeline starts at 12 hours, setting currentTime to 3600 would be an attempt to set the current playback position well before the beginning of the media, and would fail. The getStartDate() method can be used to determine the beginning point of the media timeline's reference frame.

trans-unit.source: If the manifest file has changed, all the files listed in the manifest—as well as those added to the cache by calling applicationCache.add()—are fetched into a temporary cache, following the appropriate HTTP caching rules. For each file fetched into this temporary cache, the browser sends a progress event to the applicationCache object. If any errors occur, the browser sends an error event, and the update halts.
trans-unit.target: Si el archivo de manifiesto ha cambiado, todos los archivos enumerados en el manifiesto, así como los que se agregan al caché mediante una llamada a applicationCache.add() obtienen en un caché temporal, siguiendo las reglas de caché HTTP apropiadas. Para cada archivo recuperado en esta caché temporal, el navegador envía un evento de progress al objeto applicationCache . Si se produce algún error, el navegador envía un evento de error y la actualización se detiene.

trans-unit.source: If the media is being streamed, it's possible that the user agent may not be able to obtain some parts of the resource if that data has expired from the media buffer. The getStartDate() method can be used to determine the beginning point of the media timeline's reference frame.

trans-unit.source: If the table doesn't use a colspan attribute, use the td:nth-child(an+b) CSS selector where a is the total number of the columns in the table and b is the ordinal position of the column in the table. Only after this selector the vertical-align property can be used.

If the table doesn't use a colspan attribute, use the td:nth-child(an+b) CSS selector. Set a to zero and b to the position of the column in the table, e.g. td:nth-child(2) { text-align: right; } to right-align the second column.

If there are multiple <link rel="icon">s, the browser uses their media attribute, type and sizes attributes to select the most appropriate icon. If several icons are equally appropriate, the last one is used. If the most appropriate icon is later found to be inappropriate, for example, because it uses an unsupported format, the browser proceeds to the next-most appropriate, and so on.

trans-unit.source: If we left things at that, we would at least be validating on legitimate e-mail addresses. But we want to go one step farther: we want to make sure that the e-mail address is in fact in the form "username@beststartupever.com". This is where we'll use pattern. We set pattern to .+@beststartupever.com. This simple regular expression requests a string that consists of at least one character of any kind, then an "@" followed by the domain name "beststartupever.com".
trans-unit.target: Si dejamos las cosas así, al menos estaríamos validando direcciones de correo electrónico legítimas. Pero queremos ir un paso más allá: queremos asegurarnos de que la dirección de correo electrónico tenga el formato " username @ beststartupever.com". Aquí es donde usaremos el pattern . Establecemos el pattern en .+@beststartupever.com . Esta simple expresión regular solicita una cadena que consta de al menos un carácter de cualquier tipo, luego una "@" seguida por el nombre de dominio "beststartupever.com".

trans-unit.source: If you choose to use <button> elements to create the buttons in your form, keep this in mind: if there's only one <button> inside the <form>, that button will be treated as the "submit" button. So you should be in the habit of expressly specifying which button is the submit button.
trans-unit.target: Si elige utilizar elementos <button> para crear los botones en su formulario, tenga esto en cuenta: si solo hay un <button> dentro del <form> , ese botón se tratará como el botón "enviar". Por lo tanto, debe tener el hábito de especificar expresamente qué botón es el botón de envío.

trans-unit.source: If you didn't do this, you'd have to fill in both feet/inches and meters to submit the form!
If you display this in a web browser it should look like the following.
trans-unit.target: Si lo muestra en un navegador de Internet,deber√≠a verse de la siguiente manera.

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify a value, the button will have a default label, chosen by the user agent. This label is likely to be something along the lines of "Submit" or "Submit Query." Here's an example of a submit button with a default label in your browser:
trans-unit.target: Si no especifica un value , el botón tendrá una etiqueta predeterminada, elegida por el agente de usuario. Es probable que esta etiqueta sea algo parecido a "Enviar" o "Enviar consulta". A continuación, se muestra un ejemplo de un botón de envío con una etiqueta predeterminada en su navegador:

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify a value, you get an button with the default label (typically "Reset," but this will vary depending on the user agent):
trans-unit.target: Si no especifica un value , obtendrá un botón con la etiqueta predeterminada (normalmente "Restablecer", pero esto variará según el agente de usuario ):

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify a value, you get an empty button:
trans-unit.target: Si no especifica un value , obtiene un botón vacío:

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify a value, the default is "#000000", which is black. The value must be in seven-character hexadecimal notation, meaning the "#" character followed by two digits each representing red, green, and blue, like this: "#rrggbb". If you have colors that are in any other format (such as CSS color names or CSS color functions such as rgb() or rgba(), you'll have to convert them to hexadecimal before setting the value.
trans-unit.target: Si no especifica un valor, el valor predeterminado es "#000000" , que es negro. El valor debe estar en notación hexadecimal de siete caracteres, es decir, el carácter "#" seguido de dos dígitos, cada uno de los cuales representa rojo, verde y azul, así: "#rrggbb" . Si tiene colores que están en cualquier otro formato (como nombres de color CSS o funciones de color CSS como rgb() o rgba() , tendrá que convertirlos a hexadecimal antes de establecer el value .

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify a value, the default is #000000, which is black. The value must be in seven-character hexadecimal notation, meaning the "#" character followed by two digits each representing red, green, and blue, like this: #rrggbb. If you have colors that are in any other format (such as CSS color names or CSS color functions such as rgb() or rgba()), you'll have to convert them to hexadecimal before setting the value.

If you don't specify the controls attribute, the audio player won't include the browser's default controls. You can, however, create your own custom controls using JavaScript and the HTMLMediaElement API.
If you don't specify the controls attribute, the audio player won't include the browser's default controls; you can create your own custom controls using JavaScript and the HTMLMediaElement API.
trans-unit.target: Si no especifica el atributo de controls , el reproductor de audio no incluirá los controles predeterminados del navegador; puede crear sus propios controles personalizados utilizando JavaScript y la API HTMLMediaElement .

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify the controls attribute, the video won't include the browser's default controls; you can create your own custom controls using JavaScript and the HTMLMediaElement API. See Creating a cross-browser video player for more details.
trans-unit.target: Si no especifica el atributo de controls , el video no incluirá los controles predeterminados del navegador; puede crear sus propios controles personalizados utilizando JavaScript y la API HTMLMediaElement . Consulte Creación de un reproductor de video para varios navegadores para obtener más detalles.

trans-unit.source: If you include an id attribute on the <dfn> element, you can then link to it using <a> elements. Such links should be uses of the term, with the intent being that the reader can quickly navigate to the term's definition if they're not already aware of it, by clicking on the term's link.
trans-unit.target: Si incluye un atributo id en el elemento <dfn> , puede vincularlo usando elementos <a> . Dichos enlaces deben ser usos del término, con la intención de que el lector pueda navegar rápidamente a la definición del término si aún no la conoce, haciendo clic en el enlace del término.

trans-unit.source: If you include multiple <style> and <link> elements in your document, they will be applied to the DOM in the order they are included in the document — make sure you include them in the correct order, to avoid unexpected cascade issues.
trans-unit.target: Si incluye varios elementos <style> y <link> en su documento, se aplicarán al DOM en el orden en que están incluidos en el documento; asegúrese de incluirlos en el orden correcto para evitar problemas inesperados en cascada.

trans-unit.source: If you know the directionality of EMBEDDED-TEXT in advance, you can fix this problem by wrapping EMBEDDED-TEXT in a <span> with the dir attribute set to the known directionality. But if you don't know the directionality - for example because EMBEDDED-TEXT is being read from a database or entered by the user - you should use <bdi> to prevent the directionality of EMBEDDED-TEXT from affecting its surroundings.
trans-unit.target: Si conoce la direccionalidad de EMBEDDED-TEXT de antemano, puede solucionar este problema envolviendo EMBEDDED-TEXT en un <span> con el atributo dir establecido en la direccionalidad conocida. Pero si no conoce la direccionalidad, por ejemplo, porque EMBEDDED-TEXT está siendo leído de una base de datos o ingresado por el usuario, debe usar <bdi> para evitar que la direccionalidad de EMBEDDED-TEXT afecte su entorno.

trans-unit.source: If you know the directionality of EMBEDDED-TEXT in advance, you can fix this problem by wrapping EMBEDDED-TEXT in a <span> with the dir attribute set to the known directionality. But if you don't know the directionality - for example, because EMBEDDED-TEXT is being read from a database or entered by the user - you should use <bdi> to prevent the directionality of EMBEDDED-TEXT from affecting its surroundings.
If you need an element which will serve as a container for output generated by your web site or app's JavaScript code, you should instead use the <output> element.
trans-unit.target: Si necesita un elemento que sirva como contenedor para la salida generada por su sitio web o el código JavaScript de la aplicación, debe usar el elemento <output> .

trans-unit.source: If you need an element which will serve as a container for output generated by your website or app's JavaScript code, you should instead use the <output> element.

If you need the entered URL to be restricted further than just "any string that looks like a URL," you can use the pattern attribute to specify a regular expression the value must match for the value to be valid.
trans-unit.target: Si necesita restringir la URL ingresada más allá de "cualquier cadena que parezca una URL", puede usar el atributo de pattern para especificar una expresión regular que el valor debe coincidir para que el valor sea válido.

trans-unit.source: If you need the entered e-mail address to be restricted further than just "any string that looks like an e-mail address," you can use the pattern attribute to specify a regular expression the value must match for it to be valid. If the multiple attribute is specified, each individual item in the comma-delineated list of values must match the regular expression.
trans-unit.target: Si necesita restringir la dirección de correo electrónico ingresada más allá de "cualquier cadena que parezca una dirección de correo electrónico", puede usar el atributo de pattern para especificar una expresión regular que el valor debe coincidir para que sea válida. Si se especifica el atributo multiple , cada elemento individual en la lista de valores delineados por comas debe coincidir con la expresión regular .

trans-unit.source: If you omit the value attribute in the HTML, the submitted form data assigns the value "on" to the group. In this scenario, if the user clicked on the "Phone" option and submitted the form, the resulting form data would be "contact=on", which isn't helpful. So don't forget to set your value attributes!
trans-unit.target: Si omite el atributo de value en el HTML, los datos del formulario enviado asignan el valor "on" al grupo. En este escenario, si el usuario hizo clic en la opción "Teléfono" y envió el formulario, los datos del formulario resultante serían "contact=on" , lo cual no es útil. ¡No olvide establecer sus atributos de value !

trans-unit.source: If you omit the value attribute in the HTML, the submitted form data assigns the value on to the group. In this scenario, if the user clicked on the "Phone" option and submitted the form, the resulting form data would be contact=on, which isn't helpful. So don't forget to set your value attributes!
If you really do need a polyfill, then you can use the following CSS polyfill. Works in IE10+.

trans-unit.source: If you serve XHTML-like content using the text/html MIME type, browsers will read it as HTML, and you will need the DOCTYPE to use standards mode.
trans-unit.target: Si sirve contenido similar a XHTML utilizando el tipo de text/html MIME, los navegadores lo leerán como HTML y necesitará DOCTYPE para usar el modo estándar.

trans-unit.source: If you serve your page as XHTML using the application/xhtml+xml MIME type in the Content-Type HTTP header, you do not need a DOCTYPE to enable standards mode, as such documents always use full standards mode. Note however that serving your pages as application/xhtml+xml will cause Internet Explorer 8 to show a download dialog box for an unknown format instead of displaying your page, as the first version of Internet Explorer with support for XHTML is Internet Explorer 9.
trans-unit.target: Si publica su página como XHTML usando el tipo application/xhtml+xml MIME en el encabezado HTTP Content-Type , no necesita un DOCTYPE para habilitar el modo estándar, ya que dichos documentos siempre usan el modo estándar completo. Sin embargo, tenga en cuenta que el servicio de sus páginas como application/xhtml+xml hará que Internet Explorer 8 muestre un cuadro de diálogo de descarga para un formato desconocido en lugar de mostrar su página, ya que la primera versión de Internet Explorer compatible con XHTML es Internet Explorer 9.

trans-unit.source: If you serve your videos as WebM, you can fix this problem for the Apache Web Server by adding the extension used by your video files (".webm" is the most common one) to the MIME type "video/webm" via the "mime.types" file in "/etc/apache" or via the "AddType" configuration directive in httpd.conf.
trans-unit.target: Si sirve sus videos como WebM, puede solucionar este problema para el servidor web Apache agregando la extensión utilizada por sus archivos de video (".webm" es la más común) al tipo MIME "video / webm" a través de " mime.types "en" / etc / apache "o mediante la directiva de configuración" AddType "en httpd.conf .

trans-unit.source: If you set the tabindex attribute on a <div>, then its child content cannot be scrolled with the arrow keys unless you set tabindex on the content, too. Check out this fiddle to understand the scrolling effects of tabindex.

However, you'll have to check the results to be sure the value is within these dates, since they're only enforced if the date picker is fully supported on the user's device.
trans-unit.target: Si usa min y max para restringir las fechas disponibles (consulte Establecer fechas máximas y mínimas ), los navegadores compatibles mostrarán un error si intenta enviar una fecha que está fuera de los límites establecidos. Sin embargo, deberá verificar los resultados para asegurarse de que el valor esté dentro de estas fechas, ya que solo se aplican si el selector de fechas es totalmente compatible con el dispositivo del usuario.

trans-unit.source: If you use Apache Web Server to serve Ogg Theora videos, you can fix this problem by adding the video file type extensions to "video/ogg" MIME type. The most common video file type extensions are ".ogm", ".ogv", or ".ogg". To do this, edit the "mime.types" file in "/etc/apache" or use the "AddType" configuration directive in httpd.conf.
trans-unit.target: Si usa Apache Web Server para servir videos de Ogg Theora, puede solucionar este problema agregando las extensiones de tipo de archivo de video al tipo MIME "video / ogg". Las extensiones de tipo de archivo de video más comunes son ".ogm", ".ogv" o ".ogg". Para hacer esto, edite el archivo "mime.types" en "/ etc / apache" o use la directiva de configuración "AddType" en httpd.conf .

trans-unit.source: If your buttons are not for submitting form data to a server, be sure to set their type attribute to button. Otherwise they will try to submit form data and to load the (nonexistent) response, possibly destroying the current state of the document.

trans-unit.source: If your recommended (or required) password syntax rules would benefit from an alternate text entry interface than the standard keyboard, you can use the inputmode attribute to request a specific one. The most obvious use case for this is if the password is required to be numeric (such as a PIN). Mobile devices with virtual keyboards, for example, may opt to switch to a numeric keypad layout instead of a full keyboard, to make entering the password easier. If the PIN is for one-time use, set the autocomplete attribute to off to suggest that it's not saved.
trans-unit.target: Si sus reglas de sintaxis de contraseña recomendadas (o requeridas) se beneficiarían de una interfaz de entrada de texto alternativa a la del teclado estándar, puede usar el atributo inputmode para solicitar una específica. El caso de uso más obvio para esto es si se requiere que la contraseña sea numérica (como un PIN). Los dispositivos móviles con teclados virtuales, por ejemplo, pueden optar por cambiar a un diseño de teclado numérico en lugar de un teclado completo, para facilitar la introducción de la contraseña. Si el PIN es para un solo uso, off atributo de autocomplete para sugerir que no se guarde.

trans-unit.source: If your recommended (or required) password syntax rules would benefit from an alternate text entry interface than the standard keyboard, you can use the inputmode attribute to request a specific one. The most obvious use case for this is if the password is required to be numeric (such as a PIN). Mobile devices with virtual keyboards, for example, may opt to switch to a numeric keypad layout instead of a full keyboard, to make entering the password easier. If the PIN is for one-time use, set the autocomplete attribute to either off or one-time-code to suggest that it's not saved.

Se proporciona un botón "X" para borrar el valor del control.

trans-unit.source: In Chrome/Opera the time control is simple, with slots to enter hours and minutes in 12 or 24-hour format depending on operating system locale, and up and down arrows to increment and decrement the currently selected component. trans-unit.source: In addition to the usual events supported by HTML elements, the <details> element supports the toggle event, which is dispatched to the <details> element whenever its state changes between open and closed. It is sent after the state is changed, although if the state changes multiple times before the browser can dispatch the event, the events are coalesced so that only one is sent.
trans-unit.target: Además de los eventos habituales admitidos por elementos HTML, el elemento <details> admite el evento toggle , que se envía al elemento <details> siempre que su estado cambia entre abierto y cerrado. Se envía después de que se cambia el estado, aunque si el estado cambia varias veces antes de que el navegador pueda enviar el evento, los eventos se fusionan para que solo se envíe uno.

trans-unit.source: In addition to using CSS to style inputs based on the :valid or :invalid UI states based on the current state of each input, as noted in the UI pseudo-classes section above, the browser provides for client-side validation on (attempted) form submission. On form submission, if there is a form control that fails constraint validation, supporting browsers will display an error message on the first invalid form control; displaying a default message based on the error type, or a message set by you.

In brief, .box establishes the size of each box, as well as the configuration of the font used within. We also take advantage of CSS Flexbox to easily center the contents of each box. We enable flex mode using display: flex, and set both justify-content and align-items to center. Then we can create a class for each of the two boxes that defines the properties that differ between the two.
